description: Variation of Condition 3 (Matching materials to be used on the external surfaces of the development) of planning permission ref. 35893/APP/2017/2572, dated 26/10/2018 (Part two storey, part single storey side/rear extension and conversion of roofspace to habitable use to include 3 rear dormers, 1 front dormer, 3 side rooflights, porch to front and demolition of existing conservatory and garage) to change the existing materials agreed in the schedule of materials document.
decision_conditions: The proposed external materials would fail to match the existing building and would result in a harmful mix of materials on the elevations of the existing property. The resultant mix of materials would harm both the architectural integrity of the building as well as the streetscene of Copse Wood Way, failing to preserve the character and appearance of the Area of Special Local Character. The proposal would therefore conflict with Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1, DMHB 5, DMHB 11 and DMHB 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020), conflicting with the reason for attaching the original condition.

On this decision notice policies from the Councils Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies appear first, then relevant Local Plan Part 2 (2020), then London Plan Policies (2020). Hillingdon's Full Council adopted the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies on 8 November 2012 and the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 on 16 January 2020.
